Sequence Information.Peptide Name: D6-NH2 (RK2, Arg-rich; Lys-rich; XXA, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (90%) todesign template D4-NH2R: 40%; K=W: 30%.  GRAVY: -3.54; M Wt: 1527.873; Mol formula: C70H120N28O11; molar extinction coeff: 11100.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 12 uM), S. aureus (MIC>100 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC > 100 uM)Antimicrobial robustness:  MIC changed differently in the presence of 150 mM NaCL: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli; NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa.Toxicity: it caused 6.5% hemolysis at 100 uM (low hemo.lytic).SAR: The amidated peptide was more active than the non-amidated counterpart. Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Saravanan R, Li X, Lim K, Mohanram H, Peng L, Mishra B, Basu A, Lee JM, Bhattacharjya S, Leong SS. 2014
Literature Information.Title: Design of short membrane selective antimicrobial peptides containing tryptophan and arginine residues for improved activity, salt-resistance, and biocompatibility.
